Description: Laureate head of Constantine I, right. (obverse)
Roma, helmeted, seated left on throne with shield underneath; holding small Victory on globe & leaning on sceptre. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Curator's comments: This coin does not feature in the De Salis registers but is documented as forming part of his collection.
Bibliographic references: RIC6 / The Roman Imperial Coinage, vol. 6: from Diocletian's reform (AD 294) to the death of Maximinus (AD 313) (63, p.673)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Constantine the Great
Acquisition name: Donated by: Count John Francis William de Salis
